name: Hilton Garden Inn Wilkes Barre

reviews.text: I have stayed at this Hilton a few times. The staff is always friendly and courteous. The hotel is conveniently located near the Mohegan sun arena. There are many restaurant options very close and a Japanese steakhouse right next door. The hotel has been a recently renovated. The rooms have microwaves and refrigerators. I found that the USB ports (and outlets) bed side is very convenient to have my cell phone close and always charging.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel and Great location

reviews.text: We stayed here overnight with our team. The staff went out of their way to accomodate us and make us feel welcomed as we relaxed after a day of travel. The shuttle to the Mohegan Sun Arena was convenient and prompt. Great breakfast the next day too. Everyone was very helpful and pleasant! Rooms were spacious for a family of (5). Hotel was very neat/clean.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay at the Hilton based on that it was right down the street from Mohegan Sun Arena, and it was a great choice. The staff checking in were friendly and very helpful. They let us know there was a courtesy shuttle to the arena and the casino as well. What a nice thing to have and not have to worry about driving! They also gave us vouchers for the casino as well. The room wasn't huge, but it was perfect for my boyfriend and I. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast in bed deal or even the breakfast but it looked good, next time we come down we'll have to try it. We walked over to the arena from the hotel, about a 5 minute walk. There is also a sushi/hibachi restaurant right next to the hotel that was an amazing dinner. There are also several other restaurants, liquor store, Walmart...basically anything you might need within walking distance from the hotel. We have stayed at several other HH honors places but this is the first one we've used towards points and we will definitely be returning to this hotel!
reviews.title: Perfect location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right off route 81 but nice and quiet (until the heater kicked on in the room overnight with a loud squeal)
reviews.title: Easy to get around

reviews.text: Otherwise room was nice and good price. Found breakfast a bit pricey, but food was satisfactory. Lots of stores and good inexpensive places to eat dinner and drink.
reviews.title: Not what we expected from the Hilton!

reviews.text: We spent Saturday night at this hotel in a King room. The front desk employee was very friendly at check in and our room was as reserved. The room was large and clean with a sofa, desk and chair. This is not a Hilton, Hyatt, or Mariott. It is a no frills, reasonably priced chain.
reviews.title: Nice clean no frills hotel with a wonderful staff

reviews.text: The hotel has a $10 all you can eat, made to order breakfast that is good and hot. The breakfast staff is top notch. The chef visited all the tables to insure satisfaction with his prepared meals...nice touch. Too bad that our country club at home doesnt bother to make this kind of effort.
reviews.title: Excellent people in a decent location.

reviews.text: Mohegan Sun Casino is minutes away and the hotel has a complimentary shuttle on call.
reviews.title: Great Location, Service, and much more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the room was small, it had exactly what was needed. The room was very clean, king bed was comfortable and the people (service, management, etc...) were very friendly. Surprisingly, their free coffee in the lobby tasted better than Starbucks (across the parking lot). While we were there out of necessity (lost power at home, no vacancies close-by), I would not be surprised if we stopped by in the future while on a road trip.
reviews.title: Again, great stay....

reviews.text: Upon check in the staff was very courteous. When we came to our room which was amazing, the housekeeping staff left us a note also welcoming us. The hotel was centrally located next to everything and was extremely convenient. It had everything we needed, even gave us plastic wrap when we asked. Upon check out the staff was efficient and we will definitely be coming back to visit.
reviews.title: It is the same in every city...no surprises!

reviews.text: Two night stay during Parent's weekend at our son's college. Standard Hilton Garden Inn experience. Clean room with adjustable mattress firmness (some type of air system embedded in the mattress). Heating/cooling unit a little loud and water pressure in shower a bit weak, but all in all a good property for the area.
reviews.title: Clean, attentive staff, convenient location

reviews.text: We traveled to the Wilkes-Barre area this past weekend with a small group and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn. Everyone in our group loved this hotel. It looks exactly like the pictures on the website. The location is great. There is a Starbucks directly across the street, a Walmart in walking distance in case you forgot any toiletries, and restaurants all within a five minute drive. The mall and the Lord & Taylor Outlet are nearby and the hotel provides a complimentary shuttle around the area. Each room has a mini fridge and a microwave which is a definite bonus. The beds are very comfortable and have an adjustable knob where you can make the mattress either firmer or softer. The sales manager, Amanda, was very helpful with organizing the block of rooms we needed for our group. The front desk staff was friendly and welcoming. We will definitely stay at this hotel again when we visit Wilkes Barre.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stopped in Wilkes-Barre PA on our way to Savannah. We originally went to the Holiday Inn Express but the hotel was booked with wedding guests. This turned out to be our good fortune. The Hilton Garden Inn is an awesome hotel. As the reviews state, the hotel is centrally located, right off the I81 with a variety of restaurants and shopping in the close vicinity. The rooms are large bright and clean with very comfortable beds. One night turned into two nights due to unfortunate stomach upset but that also turned into out in our favor. After calling the front desk to book an additional night and resting until 12 pm, my husband and I ventured out for some lunch. The hotel has a wonderful patio out front and since it was such a beautiful day, we soaked up the sun and enjoyed the wonderful mountain view. I then decided to take a swim in the pool. The pool was clean and had none of that strong chlorine smell that is found so often in indoor hotel pools. The coffee and fresh baked cookies in the lobby were wonderful. There was a number of staff that we met over the two days and all were friendly and very accommodating. We loved the hotel so much that we decided to return on our way back to Canada two weeks later. The front desk clerk remembered us and welcomed us back to the hotel. Very impressive. We will definitely make this hotel a place to stop on our trips down south. I highly recommend the hotel to anyone stopping in Wilkes-Barre
reviews.title: Hilton Garden Inn Wilkes Barre - Now our Stop Over Hotel

reviews.text: Heading to New England earlier this month we were lucky enough to find this excellent hotel.
reviews.title: It's How Things Are Handled

reviews.text: A small issue arose when we first checked in that was quickly addressed. The room next to ours was playing very loud music and we were moved to another floor with the explanation that they had a similar problem with the same people the day before. ???
reviews.title: Nice Hotel!

reviews.text: This is the second time we stayed at this hotel. This time around, it was for New Year's Eve. While it's nothing fancy, it's the tops for convenience, cleanliness, and customer service. The hotel is literally right in the parking lot of a shopping center with a wine & spirits store (PA thing), a Walmart, a Japanese restaurant, a Red Robin, and a host of other shops. There's an abundance of parking and the best thing was for New Year's Eve they shuttled us over to the Mohegan Sun Casino and picked us up at the end of the night. It was a second time and we will definitely be back when we're in the area. The convenience of the location to the Mohegan Sun Arena, downtown Wilkes Barre, and the casino and the pleasant staff are top notch.
reviews.title: I Love This Place

reviews.text: I'm in the area occasionally on business, and frequently find the rates here very close to the Hampton Inns in the area. Given the choice, I'll take the Garden Inn every time - better rooms, more business friendly, and a much better breakfast.
reviews.title: Good Location and Competitive Rates

reviews.text: This particular hotel's location is surrounded by a large selection of restaurants and has very easy access to the interstate highway. Especially convenient if you're attending an event at the Arena. Friendly, professional staff, and everything you'd expect from the hilton brand.
reviews.title: Well maintained hotel, friendly staff.

reviews.text: The hotel is almost directly off I-81 and is surrounded by several decent restaurants that do take-out. The front desk staff was very friendly the evening I checked in and I found the hotel to be in very good condition. The room was comfortable and spotless, the bathroom was a bit underwhelming in terms of size but otherwise serviceable.
reviews.title: Best Place in Town

reviews.text: My stay was brief but thoroughly pleasant!
reviews.title: A little tired

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Wilkes Barre Hotel Wilkes-Barre
